title: Would it be possible to reverse engineer the wooting 60he keyboard to create a new pcb?
content:
Would it be possible to build a pcb that is essentially a copy of the wooting Hall effect pcbs but with different layouts? (Ie: 65% or 75% layouts)

Would it be possible to transfer the firmware from the wooting pcb to another pcb so it is recognized by the software?

comments.text: Recognized by what software? Firmware is software. It depends on the controller so you need the same one at minimum.
Wooting has their “wootility”software. I’d like for the software to recognize the new pcb as their full-size keyboard and just program keys to match the pcb layout.
" Would it be possible ...? " is always answerable by "yes" or "no" but this will not help you.

answers_data.content: It's open source - reverse engineering isn't required because you can just look at it directly. https://github.com/WootingKb/
